info.title: Auto-generated OAS of Cassandra using OOPS

get.summary: Indicates whether this service is running
Indicates whether the Cassandra service is ready to service requests

200.description: Service is ready to handle requests

500.description: Service is not ready to handle requests

get.summary: Indicated whether the Cassandra cluster is able to achieve the specified consistency

200.description: Cassandra is able to achieve the specified consistency

500.description: Cassandra is unable to achieve the specified consistency

[-8842966077830801609, -7599446072150209: 2 replicas required, but only 1 nodes in the ring
[-7599446072150209635, -6632081829071674: 2 replicas required, but only 1 nodes in the ring

post.summary: Reload the seed node list from the seed provider

200.description: List of new seeds after reload

get.summary: Returns Job details for the supplied Job ID

post.summary: Decommission the *node I am connecting to*
Set the MB/s throughput cap for compaction in the system, or 0 to disable throttling
Forcefully remove a dead node without re-replicating any data. Use as a last resort if you cannot removenode

400.description: Cassandra node assasination request missing address

post.summary: Set the log level threshold for a given component or class. Will reset to the initial configuration if called with no parameters.
Drain the node (stop accepting writes and flush all tables)
Truncate all hints on the local node, or truncate hints for the endpoint(s) specified.
Reset node's local schema and resync
Reload local node schema from system tables
Take a snapshot

invalid_snapshot_request.value: When specifying keyspace_tables, specifying keyspaces is not allowed

post.summary: Execute a nodetool repair operation

get.summary: Get whether full query logging is enabled.

post.summary: Enable or disable full query logging facility.
Move node on the token ring to a new token. This operation returns immediately with a job id.

202.description: Job ID for successfully scheduled Cassandra node move request

post.summary: Creates a new user role

post.description: Configure Cassandra/DSE. Will fail if Cassandra/DSE is already started

application/json.description: Cassandra configuration as JSON (will be converted to YAML)

400.description: Bad Request — missing or invalid configuration or profile parameter

406.description: Not Acceptable — invalid JSON or Cassandra is already running

500.description: Server Error — IO or unexpected error

202.description: Cassandra already running and can connect

204.description: Cassandra already running but can't connect

206.description: Cassandra process not found but can connect

post.description: Stops Cassandra/DSE. Keeps node from restarting automatically until /start is called

get.description: The PID of Cassandra/DSE, if it's running

get.summary: Returns the DataCenter the local node belongs to

get.description: The MetadataResources class defines GET endpoints on subpaths of /api/v0/metadata (such as /versions/release, /endpoints, /localdc, /versions/features) but does not implement a GET method on the base path /api/v0/metadata itself.

405.description: Method Not Allowed - no GET handler implemented for this path

post.summary: Scrub (rebuild sstables for) one or more tables
Rewrite sstables (for the requested tables) that are not on the current version (thus upgrading them to said current version)
Force a (major) compaction on one or more tables or user-defined compaction on given SSTables

text/plain.example: Invalid option combination: Can not use split-output here

post.summary: Remove deleted data from one or more tables

invalidTombstoneOption.value: tombstoneOption must be either ROW or CELL

post.summary: Flush one or more tables

get.summary: List the table names in the given keyspace

parameters.description: The name of the keyspace to list tables from
parameters.name: keyspaceName

error-example.value: List tables failed. Non-empty 'keyspaceName' must be provided

post.summary: Create a new table in an existing keyspace

text/plain.example: Table creation failed: some failure message

post.summary: Triggers the immediate cleanup of keys no longer belonging to a node. By default, clean all keyspaces. This operation is blocking and will return the executed job after finishing.

jobs.description: Number of concurrent jobs for cleanup. If 0, server treats it as 1.

keyspace_name.description: Keyspace name to clean up. If blank, the server uses 'NON_LOCAL_STRATEGY' to indicate all non-local-strategy keyspaces.

tables.description: List of table names to clean up. An empty list means all tables.

200.description: Job ID for keyspace cleanup process

post.summary: Load newly placed SSTables to the system without restart

400.description: Keyspace name or Table name not provided

post.summary: Create a new keyspace with the given name and replication settings

400.description: Keyspace name or Replication Settings not provided

text/plain.example: Keyspace creation failed. Non-empty 'keyspace_name' must be provided

post.summary: Alter the replication settings of an existing keyspace

400.description: Keyspace name or Replication Settings not provided

text/plain.example: Altering Keyspace failed. Non-empty 'keyspace_name' must be provided

get.summary: List the keyspaces existing in the cluster
Get the replication settings of an existing keyspace

text/plain.example: Get keyspace replication failed. Non-empty 'keyspaceName' must be provided
Get keyspace replication failed. Keyspace 'my_keyspace' does not exist.

post.summary: Decommission the *node I am connecting to*. This invocation returns immediately and returns a job id.

202.description: Job ID for successfully scheduled Cassandra node decommission request

post.summary: Rebuild data by streaming data from other nodes. This operation returns immediately with a job id.

202.description: Job ID for successfully scheduled Cassandra node rebuild request

200.description: Gets the schema versions for each node. Useful for checking schema agreement

post.summary: Scrub (rebuild sstables for) one or more tables. This operation is asynchronous and returns immediately.

202.description: Job ID for table scrub process

post.summary: Rewrite sstables (for the requested tables) that are not on the current version (thus upgrading them to said current version). This operation is asynchronous and returns immediately.

202.description: Job ID for keyspace SSTable upgrade process

post.summary: Force a (major) compaction on one or more tables or user-defined compaction on given SSTables

202.description: Job ID for keyspace compaction process

invalidOption.value: Invalid option combination: Can not use split-output here

post.summary: Triggers the immediate cleanup of keys no longer belonging to a node. By default, clean all keyspaces. This operation is asynchronous and returns immediately

200.description: Cleanup not needed for tables 'system' or 'system_schema'

202.description: Job ID for keyspace cleanup process
